Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AaeAP2 (natural AMPs; scorpions, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: 94.7% SIMILAR TOscorpion AaeAP1.Activity:  Active against C. albicans (MIC 32 ug/ml), E.coli (MIC >512 ug/ml), and S. aureus (MIC 16 ug/ml). UPdated 7/2024
Literature Information.Author: Du Q, Hou X, Wang L, Zhang Y, Xi X, Wang H, Zhou M, Duan J, Wei M, Chen T, Shaw C.2015
Literature Information.Title: AaeAP1 and AaeAP2: Novel Antimicrobial Peptides from the Venom of the Scorpion, Androctonus aeneas: Structural Characterisation, Molecular Cloning of Biosynthetic Precursor-Encoding cDNAs and Engineering of Analogues with Enhanced Antimicrobial and Anticancer Activities
